node.title: Some cancer patients face higher risks than others. But these women are hoping to change that
node.alt: Thit smiling as she ladles some laksa soup into a bright red bowl, for a woman wearing a head covering.
node.description: Navigating the healthcare system can be tough, and cancer patients from multicultural backgrounds can face more risks and challenges than the general population. But a university project and support from women with lived experience is helping make treatment safer.
node.content:
["It's been more than a year since Thit Tieu has been able to invite members of her multicultural Sister Cancer Support Group inside her home, south of Sydney.", "When the ABC visited, she was serving them a batch of her famous laksa soup for lunch.", "\"This is one of my favourite foods, though this is a Burmese style, we call it 'ohn no khao swe',\" Ms Tieu tells her guests\u00a0as they fall silent to devour their meal.", "\"You know, when everyone goes quiet, in Burmese tradition, it means the food is very good and they don't want to stop the eating. It's a good sign.\"", "Ms Tieu doesn't like to be referred to as \"a breast cancer survivor\". Instead, she describes herself as someone who is \"living well after cancer\".", "\"Survivor has this connotation,\" she tells\u00a0the ABC.", "She created the support group after beating stage three ductal carcinoma, a form of breast cancer.", "", "
Members of the Sister Cancer Support Group help support other multicultural cancer patients.(ABC News: Brendan Esposito)
", "She says people like her from multicultural backgrounds need\u00a0better support to navigate the healthcare system.\u00a0", "\"Being a little Asian woman, there were a lot of unforeseen hurdles that I had to overcome when I was going through the system and treatment,\" Ms Tieu said.", "\"There is an assumption that someone that looks like me may not be able to speak English, and I don't think that is right.\"", "Ms Tieu says she did not feel a sense of belonging during her treatment \u2014\u00a0and it was a continuing theme during her aftercare, when she was learning important tips for living life post-cancer.", "\"Everywhere I [went], I was the only Asian sitting there,\" she recalls.", "\"I started asking questions [about the] multicultural women that I saw at the hospital: What are they doing? How are they looking after themselves?", "\"That made me think that [there] needs to be something done to help these ladies so that they will be able to understand what they need to do through their cancer journey.\"", "", "
Thit started the group after her own experience getting cancer treatment.(ABC News: Brendan Esposito)
", "
Healthcare-related harm
", "Members of the Sister Cancer Support Group act as advocates and supporters for other multicultural cancer patients.", "They can also help to explain how the healthcare system works, give details about different medications, offer support if a patient wants to speak up about something, and act as interpreters if needed.", "Research shows patients with culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds typically experience more healthcare-related harm than the general population.", "", "
Thit Tieu is glad her experience is helping improve safety for other cancer patients.(ABC News: Brendan Esposito)
", "Healthcare-related harm is an unintended injury as a result of a patient's medical care \u2014\u00a0or lack thereof \u2014\u00a0which typically requires treatment and, in a worst-case scenario, can result in death.", "According to the World Health Organization, the occurrence of adverse events due to unsafe care is likely one of the 10 leading causes of death and disability in the world. Many times, the harm could have been prevented.", "CALD patients are particularly susceptible for a variety of reasons, including language barriers, complex health networks, and less patient engagement.", "For cancer patients, the risks are even greater because they need to use the system far more frequently than other patients, and the drugs they are exposed to are so potent.", "It's a reality that prompted associate professor Reema Harrison, from Macquarie University, to investigate and launch the CanChange Project, in association with Cancer Australia and the National Health and Medical Research Council.", "Dr Harrison and a team of researchers examined medical records from NSW and Victoria to identify the patient safety incidents for patients from CALD backgrounds.", "One of the most error-prone areas, the research found, was around issuing medications. Again, the toxicity of drugs used in cancer treatments makes this area particularly problematic.", "\"[CALD patients]\u00a0might be given medication that is for a different patient,\" Dr Harrison said.", "\"Often, similar-sounding names are in different orders, and those kinds of things can lead to medication mistakes.\"", "The team is also building a network of diverse health consumers \u2014\u00a0especially those well engaged in their local health area like Thit Tieu \u2014\u00a0to help co-design programs and policies with clinicians for health districts to reduce patient harm.", "They hope the program will improve engagement between patients and medical staff and encourage patients to speak up if they suspect something is wrong.", "
Getting involved to make a difference
", "Mashreka Sarwar is involved in Dr Harrison's program.", "She signed up after developing a serious illness from medication she was prescribed when she had cancer.", "Her husband is a doctor, and before she was diagnosed with cancer, she was studying for her master's degree in public health.", "But\u00a0even with that background, she found the healthcare system difficult to navigate.", "", "
Mashreka found the healthcare system difficult to navigate as a patient.(Supplied)
", "So\u00a0when she started to feel extremely unwell during her treatment, she kept quiet instead of reaching out for help.", "\"When you are coming from outside, or another country, it is a new system for us,\" Ms Sarwar said.", "\"We don't know [to speak up].\"", "It wasn't until her husband realised her health was deteriorating that he intervened and booked her an appointment with a specialist.", "She was eventually diagnosed with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease; something she is still dealing with five years on. It was likely caused by her medication, and an earlier diagnosis could have prevented much of the damage.", "Now, she hopes to be a voice to speak up for patients.", "\"Some patients are less likely to voice their concern if culture is not inclusive,\" she said.", "\"Hopefully implementation of this intervention will make a big difference in the CALD cancer patient treatment safety.\"", "", "
Thit Tieu is glad her work is helping to make a difference.(ABC News: Brendan Esposito)
", "The federal government said it had identified CALD people as a priority population in several national strategies and programs, and was also working to set up a helpline for CALD communities.", "Dr Harrison said, while a lot of consumer-engagement programs existed, she had trouble finding ones specifically involving CALD patients.", "\"This is a piece of the puzzle that is hopefully going to show people it can be done,\" she said.", "Thit Tieu is just glad that her experience and input is helping to improve patient safety and strengthen the bond between the multicultural communities and health providers.", "\"The cancer service is constantly working very hard to provide for everyone,\" she said.", "\"But they need a bit of assistance, like the research work that Reema is doing, to show them how to improve the system.\""]
